sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Typewritten letter from Louis Koch to Schenker, dated October 23, 1913
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: Koch lists the Beethoven manuscript items in his possession.
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: Manuscript; Titelblatt; title-page; Correcturen; corrections; Bemerkungen; annotations; Noten; notes; Skizzen; sketches

tei:opener.tei:salute:
Sehr geehrter Herr!Receipt of this letter is recorded in Schenker's diary at OJ 1/13, p. 454, October 25, 1913: "Von Herrn Koch, Frankfurt a/M, Brief mit Aufzählung der Manuskripte. Ein sehr liebenswürdiger Zug, der in Wien sicher nicht angetroffen anzutreffen
würde wäre ! Er versprach die Antwort für Ende des Monats u. ohne neuen Urgieren hielt er Wort!" ("Letter from Mr Koch, Frankfurt am Main, with a list of the manuscripts. A very kind trait, certainly not to be encountered in Vienna! He promised the answer at the end of the month and kept his word without renewed demand!")

tei:div.tei:p: Von einer Reise hierher zurückgekehrt finde ich Ihre werten Zeilen vom 29. pto. vor.This letter to Koch is recorded in Schenker's diary at OJ 1/13, p. 431, September 29, 1913: "Anfrage an Juwelier Koch wegen der Autographe." ("Enquiry to the jeweller Koch about the autograph manuscripts.") The letter is not known to survive.

Von Beethoven-Manuscripten besitze ich die folgenden Piecen: 1.) Ouverture zu „Egmont”, Titelblatt und zahlreiche Correcturen und Bemerkungen von Beethovens Hand.This manuscript, principally in the hand of two copyists, is now Bonn, Beethovenhaus, NE 64, and contains the entire incidental music for "Egmont", not merely the Overture.
2.) Sonate in As-dur op. 110, 3ter und 4ter Satz"op. 110 ... Satz" ("Op. 110 ... movement") underlined by Schenker and cross marked in left margin, all in pencil. This manuscript is now Bonn, Beethovenhaus, BMh 2/42.
3.) Skizzenbuch aus den Jahren 1815 und 1816This is the "Scheide" Sketchbook, today in the library of William Scheide, Princeton University, New Jersey. Koch's figure of 52 leaves is inaccurate: see Douglas Johnson, Alan Tyson, and Robert Winter, The Beethoven Sketchbooks: History, Reconstruction, Inventory, ed. Douglas Johnson (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1985), p. 241, where the correct figure of "56 (or 551/4) leaves" is given. 52 Seiten;
enthaltend: Noten und Skizzen zur Sonate für Piano und Cello, op. 102
enthaltend Liederkreis op. 98, op. 101 etc.
4.) irische Lieder, 22 Seiten: Quartett für 2 Violinen, Cello und Pianoforte.This manuscript, presently in the private collection of William Zachs (UK), contains six folksong settings of various nationalities: Op. 108, No. 24 (Scottish), WoO 153, No. 32 (Irish), WoO 155, No. 25 (Welsh), and WoO 156, Nos 3–4 (Scottish). The instrumental setting is for piano trio. See Ludwig van Beethoven: Thematisch-bibliographisches Werkverzeichnis, ed. Kurt Dorfmüller, Norbert Gertsch, and Julia Ronge, 2 vols (Munich: Henle, 2014), I, 690 (no. 12); II, 404 (no. 3), 426 (no. 6), 440 (no. 4).
5.) schottische Lieder, 2 Violinen, Cello und Pianoforte, 24 Seiten op108This manuscript, containing Op. 108, Nos 5, 6, 7, 10, and 19, is now divided between New York, Pierpont Morgan Library, Cary Collection 275 (nos 5, 10, and 19) and a private collection (nos 6–7). According to Ludwig van Beethoven: Thematisch-bibliographisches Werkverzeichnis, ed. Kurt Dorfmüller, Norbert Gertsch, and Julia Ronge, 2 vols (Munich: Henle, 2014), I, 689 (nos 6–7), the manuscripts comprise respectively six and five leaves: thus, 22 rather than 24 pages. The instrumental setting of Op. 108 is for solo violin (or flute), cello, and piano..
Wenn Sie die Sachen interessiren, so stelle ich Ihnen solche gerne hier zur Verfügung.
Having returned here from a trip, I find your valued lines of the 29th inst.

I possess the following manuscript items of Beethoven: 1. Overture to "Egmont", title-page and extensive corrections and annotations in Beethoven's hand.
2. Sonata in A major, Op. 110, 3rd and 4th movement
3. Sketchbook from the years 1815 and 1816, 52 pages;
containing: notes and sketches for the Sonata for piano and cello, Op. 102 No. 2
containing Liederkreis, Op. 98, Op. 101, etc.
4. Irish Songs, 22 pages: Quartet for 2 violins, cello and pianoforte
5. Scottish Songs, 2 violins, cello and pianoforte, 24 pages, Op. 108.
If these things are of interest to you, I will gladly put them at your disposal here.
